example[1]: They set off at a brisk pace.
definition[1]: quick, practical, and showing that you want to get things done quickly
example[2]: Her tone of voice is brisk.
definition[2]: trade or business that is brisk is very busy, with a lot of products being sold
example[3]: The public bar was already doing a brisk trade.
definition[3]: weather that is brisk is cold and clear
definition[4]: business or trading that is brisk is very busy, with a lot of products, shares etc bought and sold
example[4]: Restaurants do brisk business at Thanksgiving.
example[5]: Following several days of brisk trading, the junk bond market was quiet.
